DOC.brief_summary: The investigators wish to determine whether passive leg raise allows for easier peripheral vascular access in the pediatric population. The investigators hypothesize that pediatric anesthesiologists will have higher rates of successful intravenous catheterization in children where a passive leg raise is employed.
DOC.brief_title: Effect of Passive Leg Raise for Pediatric Peripheral IV Placement
DOC.criteria: pediatric participants undergoing dental procedures under general anesthesia Children who already have adequate IV access
